data.commentary:
Due to the recent extreme snowfall and the challenging road conditions expected tomorrow, considering public transportation for your commute is advisable. If you must drive and your vehicle is a two‚Äëwheel‚Äëdrive automatic model from the last ten years, remember to shift to M and lock it in M2 for better traction compared to D. For older automatic vehicles, look for L2 and use that to drive out of deep snow. And if your car only has D‚Ä¶ well, good luck üòÑ
For manual‚Äëtransmission cars, try starting in 2nd gear when moving out of deep snow. If 1st gear causes too much wheel spin or doesn‚Äôt give you enough controlled power, 2nd gear often provides smoother traction and helps the car move forward more steadily.

When driving out of snow, keep your speed low until the wheels stop slipping, then continue smoothly at a controlled pace. For safer winter driving, preheat your front window and take extra time to thoroughly clear all windows. Maintain a safe distance from other vehicles and use gradual braking instead of sudden stops. These small habits significantly improve visibility and reduce the risk of accidents on slippery roads.

These tips come from 30+ years behind the wheel both in China and Sweden. Put them to the test again today helping a rear-wheel-drive BMW 5 Series and a front-wheel-drive XC60 get unstuck from the snow. Hope this helps someone stay safe out there this winter.

#WinterDriving #SnowSafety #DrivingTips #VehicleControl #DefensiveDriving #SafeCommute #CommunitySupport #SnowFallWeather #Gothenburg #M√∂lndal #Lindholmen

data.commentary:
New Year, New Project No.2: AI Math Grader
I recently applied for a full‚Äëstack role that requires hands‚Äëon experience with OpenAI, LangChain, Vercel AI SDK, and similar tools. I know the concepts well, but hadn‚Äôt actually built anything with them yet.
At the same time, my daughter has a competitive math entrance exam in a month. We covered about 65% of the material last year‚Ä¶ and we‚Äôve probably forgotten more than that by now : P
So I combined both challenges into one project.
Using Claude Sonnet 4.5 via Google #Antigravity, I built a full AI math‚Äëgrading system in about 3 hours. It takes iPhone photos (HEIC), reads the handwritten exam year, compares her answers against 15 years of past exams (2010‚Äì2025), runs everything through an LLM, and gives instant feedback in Swedish. It even exports a PDF for review.

Tech stack:
LangChain LCEL workflow
Vercel AI SDK streaming
Gemini Pro 2.0 Flash
Provider‚Äëagnostic (OpenAI / Anthropic / Groq)
Next.js 16, TypeScript, Zod
Local RAG built from the exam archives

Now she practices, I snap a photo, and the AI project handles the grading. No more pretending I remember middle‚Äëschool math 100% correctly at 11 PM ‚Äî and I get real hands‚Äëon experience with the exact tools employers keep asking for.
Curious to hear from others:
How do you help your kids prep for exams?
Developers: what real‚Äëworld problems have you solved with your own #RAG setups?
PM if you want to know more about this project, and please feel free to comment, repost, or like if this resonates with your experiences : )


Resource: https://lnkd.in/eeXjhQKb

#AI #LLM #LangChain #Gemini #VercelAI #BuildInPublic #ParentingInTech #RealWorldAI #RAG

data.commentary:
iPad Remote Development - No SSH or Terminal Apps Required

Hej,
Hope you all had a great Christmas. As a New Year's gift to the dev community, I want to share something I've been working on.

Today I successfully connected to my VPS from my iPad Pro Gen 3 and started coding - directly from Safari. No SSH apps, no terminal emulators, just a browser.

Tested over Tele2 cellular 4G connection - proving this works anywhere you have mobile data.

Solving iPad's Development Problem

The main reasons developers avoid iPad for serious work:
- No proper terminal tools
- Limited code IDE support
- Poor SSH connection options
- iOS sandboxing restrictions

This project solves all of these by moving the development environment to a server and accessing it through Safari. Now your iPad becomes a true development machine.

¬†What Works

¬†- Full terminal access in Safari
¬†- Git workflow (commit, push, PR creation)
¬†- File editing with vim/nano
¬†- AI-assisted coding (OpenAI integration)
¬†- Virtual keyboard optimized for touch
¬†- Sessions persist across disconnects
¬†- MFA with Google Authenticator for highest security

Built with Kiro and Claude Code Sonnet 4.5

This entire project was built using Kiro and Claude Code Sonnet 4.5 - proving that AI-assisted development can create real, production-ready tools. Now it enables vibe coding anywhere you have your iPad and internet connection. Coffee shop, airport, wherever - just open Safari and code.

Why This Matters

¬†The iPad Pro has the hardware for serious development work, but iOS limitations have always been the blocker. By running the dev environment on a server and accessing through Safari, we bypass those limitations completely.

You get:
- Full Linux environment
- All your command-line tools
- Your entire workflow, just accessible from anywhere
- No need to carry a laptop
- Secure access with multi-factor authentication

Technical Stack

- WebSocket for real-time communication
- xterm.js for browser terminal
- node-pty for shell management
- TypeScript monorepo
- PWA support
- TOTP-based MFA (Google Authenticator)

Next Steps

I'm developing several deployment scenarios for devs with(out) a VPS:

1. With VPS (what I'm using now)
2. Tailscale VPN (connect iPad to your Mac at home, no VPS needed)
3. Cloudflare Tunnel (permanent setup with custom domain)
4. ngrok (quick testing)
5. GitHub Codespaces (backup option)

For developers without a VPS, options 2-5 mean you can still work remotely with just your Mac at home and your iPad.

Open Source

Will be releasing this for the community soon. Whether you have a VPS, a Mac at home, or just use Codespaces - you'll be able to vibe code from your iPad anywhere you have internet. Forget your MBP and MBA, now in 2026, it is time to work from anywhere with just an iPad.

¬†Interested in trying this? Keep an eye on the updates of this projejct.

#WebDev #iPad #RemoteDev #Opensource #Claudecode #SSH #TCPIP #Terminal

data.commentary:
üí° Unlocking Company Profits Made Simple!
Ever wondered how a company generates profits? As a stakeholder, employee, client, customer, or curious individual, you don't need specialized knowledge or skills to understand financial reports. All you need is the company's financial report (yearly or quarterly) and some tools like #GoogleAIStudio, #NanoBananaPro and the inspiration from www.voronoi.com as well.
Let's use Volvo Cars' Q3 2025 report as an example. By inputting the data into the AI platform, you can create a visual representation of how Volvo Cars made money in Q3 2025, similar to the provided image of Nvidia.
This era of #AI empowers us to overcome many barriers like Data Visualization, Data Analysis, Frontend Development, UX/UI, and more. Now, when your boss asks about the company's revenue sources and expenses, you have a clear and visually engaging answer.

data.commentary:
Tonight, I successfully renewed my Finansiell ID-Teknik - BankID  using the SEB mobile app in just 25 seconds. I was prompted to do so because my BankID was about to expire in 57 days. However, my wife is facing issues installing BankID on her new #iPhone17 due to a defect in the ICA Banken's app on #iPhoneX. We contacted ICA Banken's call center, and they asked us to wait for an in-app message. Unfortunately, after two weeks waiting, with their instructions, we're still stuck in a loop when trying to sign with BankID for authenticating the installation of new BankID on new iPhone, basically nothing being changed. Following the call center's suggestion, we booked an appointment with SEB tomorrow. We might have to close our ICA Banken account, as they don't seem to care about our issue and advised us to find a bank with a physical office.
Sometimes, businesses overlook customer complaints about their products or services, believing that losing one customer isn't a big deal. However, the negative impact of such experiences goes beyond just one customer, as it spreads through word-of-mouth and online reviews.
With virtual banks like Revolut emerging, the advantages of traditional banks are becoming less obvious. When customers are charged 20 SEK per month and find that their app isn't compatible with new devices, it's only natural for them to switch to other banks. 
This experience serves as a reminder that businesses can't afford to become complacent. Failing to continuously improve products and services will inevitably result in losing customers, as they seek better alternatives. Ultimately, prioritizing customer satisfaction and staying ahead of the competition are key to long-term success.

#ICABanken #BankID #SEB #Revolution #CustomerService

data.commentary:
Even when Cloud giant Amazon Web Services (AWS) promises 99.99% uptime, that 0.01% downtime can still significantly impact the public. Sure, Duolingo being temporarily unavailable might not matter to some, but imagine holding Amazon Web Services (AWS) stocks on Robinhood and wanting to sell during a dip at the same time. A grain of sand in one era can grow into a mountain of trouble for a family.Isn‚Äôt it time we asked ourselves: Why place all our eggs in a single cloud provider‚Äôs basket?
When will our private clouds rise to the occasion and come to the rescue?

#AWSDowntime #CloudComputing #Diversify #PrivateClouds #CloudReliability"

data.commentary:
There‚Äôs been a lot of buzz around NVIDIA DGX Spark since October 15th, so let‚Äôs talk about two compact #BareMetals that keep coming up in comparison: NVIDIA‚Äôs DGX Spark and Apple‚Äôs Mac mini M4 Pro.
Here are my observations:
üîπ Mac mini M4 Pro
‚Ä¢ 	64GB unified memory
‚Ä¢ 	macOS 26 ‚ÄúTahoe‚Äù
‚Ä¢ 	Seamless integration with Apple‚Äôs ecosystem
‚Ä¢ 	Compact, quiet, and versatile
üîπ NVIDIA DGX Spark
‚Ä¢ 	128GB RAM
‚Ä¢ 	4TB SSD
‚Ä¢ 	~273GB/s memory bandwidth
‚Ä¢ 	Runs a customized Ubuntu 24 Linux OS
Both machines deliver impressive AI performance (roughly comparable to an RTX 3090 Ti in some scenarios). But their focus is different:
‚Ä¢ 	DGX Spark is clearly aimed at professionals running heavy AI/ML workloads. The extra RAM and storage make it a specialized tool for model training and large‚Äëscale experiments.
‚Ä¢ 	Mac mini M4 Pro is an all‚Äërounder. It‚Äôs perfect for those who want a premium desktop that handles everyday tasks effortlessly while still being capable of serious compute work. The Apple ecosystem and macOS polish make it a smooth experience.
üí° So which one makes sense?
‚Ä¢ 	If your priority is intensive AI/ML modeling, DGX Spark is the better fit.
‚Ä¢ 	If you want a versatile, user‚Äëfriendly system that balances performance with everyday usability, the Mac mini M4 Pro is hard to beat.
For me personally, I don‚Äôt see a reason to choose the DGX Spark at this price point. There are more cost‚Äëeffective alternatives out there ‚Äî for example:
üëâ https://lnkd.in/dmrJ-pjp
Don‚Äôt get blinded by the NVIDIA halo effect. Choose what truly fits your needs. If it were up to me, I‚Äôd go with the Mac mini M4 Pro (64GB / 2TB).

Resources:
1. 	https://lnkd.in/d7Ct_CFS
2. 	https://lnkd.in/dUNNav3T

#NVIDIA #DGXSpark #Apple #MacMiniM4Pro #Ubuntu24 #macOS26Tahoe #MachineLearning #AIHardware

data.commentary:
Learn to build your own voice-activated AI assistant that can execute tasks like gathering recent AI news from the web, scripting out a podcast, and using tools to put all that into a multi-speaker podcast. See our new short course: "Building Live Voice Agents with Google‚Äôs ADK (Agent Development Kit),‚Äù  taught by Google‚Äôs Lavi Nigam and Sita Lakshmi Sangameswaran. 

ADK provides modular components that make it easy to build and debug agents. It also includes a built-in web interface for tracing agentic reasoning. This course illustrates these concepts via  building a live voice agent that can chain actions to complete a complex task like creating a podcast. This requires maintaining context, implementing guardrails, reasoning, and handling audio streaming, while keeping latency low.

You‚Äôll learn to:
- Build voice agents that listen, reason, and respond
- Guide your agent to follow a specific workflow to accomplish a task
- Coordinate specialized agents to build an agentic podcast workflow that researches topics and produces multi-speaker audio
- Understand how to deploy an agent into production

Even if you‚Äôre not yet building voice systems, you'll find understanding how realtime agents stream data and maintain reliability useful for designing modern agentic applications.

Please join here: https://lnkd.in/ga6tD5rt
